author: Special Correspondent
text:
Election officials plan to use unique cultural aspects to attract voters

The District Election Office is planning to adopt varying strategies, each matching the uniqueness of a particular locality in the city, to promote electoral participation.

Following a meeting on Thursday, election officials have been asked to identify unique cultural aspects of each neighbourhood while devising programmes aimed at encouraging people to vote.

For example, while organising such a programme in an area with a large number of homeless or migrant people, a particular set of slogans or appeals may be used based on their background.

Work on identification of polling stations with the lowest turnout in each constituency is under way. Officials will analyse the reasons for low turnout and come up with programmes for these areas after a study of what would connect with them.

“Programmes will be designed to address the social or cultural factors, if any, that caused the low turnout during the last elections,” said the official. Street plays may be adopted in areas where they can be expected to strike a chord with residents.

Chennai District Election Office is likely to focus on creating awareness among school children in such neighbourhoods to persuade their parents to vote in elections. New activities have also been planned on social media.
